This map shows the distribution of HUC10 watersheds across parts of New Mexico and Arizona. Watersheds are color-coded by the larger HUC4 watershed that contains them. You can find the HUC ID for each watershed by clicking the feature on the map.

```{r}
#| fig-height: 4

library(sf)
library(mapview)

# map_colors <- c(
#   "#290E10", "#3C1518", "#872B07", "#A44200", "#D49F56", "#EBD990", "#F3F4B5"
# )

huc10 <- read_sf("watersheds.geojson")

# xy <- huc10 |> 
#   st_union() |> 
#   st_centroid() |> 
#   st_coordinates() |> 
#   c()

mapview(
  huc10, 
  zcol = "Subregion", 
  layer.name = "HUC10",
  legend = FALSE, 
  lwd = 0.8, 
  color = "#24292F",
  # col.region = map_colors,
  alpha.regions = 0.4,
  zoom = 7
)#@map |> 
  # leaflet::setView(xy[1], xy[2], zoom = 6)

```
